decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Gilded Goose and Leafkin Druid to play powerful planeswalkers such as Oko, Thief of Crowns, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, and Teferi, Time Raveler. It also utilizes creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Voracious Hydra for value, while maintaining board control with Deputy of Detention and Wicked Wolf. Risen Reef provides card advantage and helps to keep the deck moving smoothly. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through mana advantage, powerful threats, and efficient removal.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board of small, efficient creatures and boosting them with anthem effects like Heraldic Banner and Venerated Loxodon. It also utilizes cards like Unbreakable Formation and Conclave Tribunal to protect creatures and remove threats. Mobilized District and Castle Ardenvale provide additional utility and late-game options. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of weenies, backed up by powerful creature enhancements and removal spells to maintain board presence and pressure throughout the game.

The main idea of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix, while also milling the opponent with Drowned Secrets and Wall of Lost Thoughts. The deck utilizes cheap spells like Opt and Unsummon to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability and Creeping Chill for direct damage. Mission Briefing and Discovery / Dispersal provide card selection and recursion. Brazen Borrower can bounce problematic permanents. Castle Vantress and Mystic Sanctuary offer additional utility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells.

The main goal of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and efficient creatures. By playing aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Venerated Loxodon, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. With cards like Faerie Guidemother and Giant Killer providing support and removal options, the deck is able to maintain board control while also utilizing cards like Once Upon a Time and Edgewall Innkeeper to ensure consistent draws and mana curve.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route to play powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. It also utilizes control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Time Wipe to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to create an overwhelming board presence with Field of the Dead while keeping the opponent's options limited with counterspells and bounce effects. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and overwhelming them with a combination of big creatures and land tokens.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker, Questing Beast, and Bonecrusher Giant while also utilizing cards like Domri, Anarch of Bolas and Domri's Ambush to maintain board control. The addition of Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Skarrgan Hellkite provide additional power and flexibility to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle with a mix of Forests, Mountains, and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and deal damage efficiently to win the game.

This deck focuses on maintaining a consistent aggressive gameplay by quickly deploying low-cost creatures and exploiting synergy for maximum damage output. It combines powerful creatures like Spawn of Mayhem and Knight of the Ebon Legion with disruptive cards like Drill Bit and Rankle, Master of Pranks to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven allows for card advantage and incremental damage, while Ayara, First of Locthwain provides additional reach and potentially stabilizes the board. With a mixture of aggression, disruption, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents swiftly.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently utilizing mana resources and card draw effects, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and consistently apply pressure to the opponent. The key strategy is to constantly deal damage to the opponent's life total while controlling the board with removal spells. With a mix of cheap creatures, efficient burn spells, and card draw effects, the deck aims to outpace and outdamage the opponent before they can stabilize or mount a defense.

The main idea of this Bant Control deck is to establish control of the game through card advantage and efficient removal. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with disruptive cards like Deputy of Detention, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy while ramping up its own resources with cards like Hydroid Krasis and Once Upon a Time. The deck also focuses on mana acceleration and fixing with cards like Gilded Goose and Fabled Passage to ensure consistency and flexibility in its plays.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful control cards such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Realm-Cloaked Giant. By using cards like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route, it can quickly reach the necessary mana to play big threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. Additionally, the deck includes a land package that allows for the creation of multiple Zombie tokens with Field of the Dead, providing a win condition that overwhelms opponents. The goal is to control the game through powerful spells and overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful cards such as Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. It also employs Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and Realm-Cloaked Giant as a board wipe option. The deck uses Circuitous Route and Growth Spiral to accelerate land drops and utilize Field of the Dead to create zombie tokens. The variety of guildgates and temples provide different colors of mana to cast the diverse array of spells in the deck. The overall strategy is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient mana usage and powerful card choices.

The deck focuses on maximizing value from Adventure cards and generating multiple triggers from Lucky Clover. By fueling the early game with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, along with card advantage from Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Removal spells like Legion's End and Murderous Rider help control the board while generating tempo. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck while also utilizing Fabled Passage for additional deck thinning and color fixing.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays by utilizing adventure creatures and the synergy between Lucky Clover and adventure spells. The deck aims to swarm the board with creatures like Smitten Swordmaster and Foulmire Knight while generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper and Midnight Reaper. The inclusion of Murderous Rider and Knight of the Ebon Legion provides versatile removal and added pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes Ayara, First of Locthwain for additional value and Castle Locthwain for card draw. Overall, the deck is designed to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The primary emphasis of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient creature removal. By utilizing low-cost creatures such as Knight of the Ebon Legion and Gutterbones, along with powerful cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Murderous Rider, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. With cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Castle Locthwain providing additional utility and card advantage, the deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent for a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with low-cost creatures like Spectral Sailor, Wildborn Preserver, and Breeding Pool, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with counter spells like Quench, Sinister Sabotage, and Negate. Nightpack Ambusher provides a powerful late-game threat, while Frilled Mystic adds versatility and control. The deck also includes card draw with Anticipate and Opt, and tempo plays with Brazen Borrower and Unsummon. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and spells while maintaining control of the game.

The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Gilded Goose and Leafkin Druid, allowing for the early deployment of powerful threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Wicked Wolf and Voracious Hydra provide additional threats to pressure the opponent, with Brazen Borrower offering versatility in dealing with opposing threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and efficient mana usage, utilizing the Simic color combination for its strong aggro potential.
